item.title: 苹果正在为眼镜、新 Mac 和人工智能服务器开发专用芯片
item.description: 苹果公司的硅设计小组正在开发新的芯片，这些芯片将成为未来设备的大脑，包括首款智能眼镜、功能更强大的 Mac 和人工智能服务器。【原文：Apple Inc.’s silicon design group is working on new chips that will serve as the brains for future devices, including its first smart glasses, more powerful Macs and artificial intelligence servers.】

item.title: 英国房主可感谢特朗普促使英国央行降息
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易政策正在颠覆长期以来建立的联盟，威胁全球经济增长，并给企业带来混乱。不过，对于英国的房主来说，这一切都很顺利。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s trade policy is upending long-held alliances, threatening global growth and causing mayhem for business. For UK homeowners, though, it is working out quite well.】

item.title: 尽管受到特朗普的批评，鲍威尔仍让国会站在他一边
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的无情打击下，杰罗姆-鲍威尔需要他能得到的所有盟友；而他在国会中拥有很多盟友，包括那些对抛弃这位美联储主席没有多大兴趣的共和党人。【原文：Under relentless attack from President Donald Trump, Jerome Powell needs all the allies he can get — and he has plenty in Congress, including among Republicans who show little appetite for ditching the Federal Reserve chief.】

item.title: 与特朗普儿子合作的比特币矿商收入下降
item.description: 比特币挖矿公司Hut 8 Corp.最近与唐纳德-特朗普总统的儿子们合作成立了一家新企业，该公司表示其第一季度盈利转为亏损，收入暴跌50%以上。【原文：Bitcoin mining company Hut 8 Corp., which recently partnered with President Donald Trump’s sons on a new venture, said its first-quarter earnings swung to a loss and revenue tumbled by more than 50%.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率维持在 6.76% 的水平
item.description: 美国的抵押贷款利率维持在上周的水平，使购房者的压力居高不下。【原文：Mortgage rates in the US stayed put at levels reached last week, keeping the pressure high for homebuyers.】

item.title: 特朗普认为 "实质性 "对华谈判可能带来关税削减
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，他相信本周末与中国启动的贸易谈判将取得切实进展，他预测中国政府将愿意做出让步，并表示如果谈判势头明显，他可以考虑削减对中国的惩罚性关税。【原文：US President Donald Trump said he believed trade negotiations launching this weekend with China would result in tangible progress, predicting Beijing would be willing to make concessions and saying he could consider cutting punishing tariffs against the country if there were significant momentum.】

item.title: 必和必拓支持的索尔金矿公司（SolGold）转向加快采矿计划以吸引投资者
item.description: 索尔黄金公司（SolGold Plc）是一家专注于厄瓜多尔的公司，得到了矿业界一些大公司的支持，该公司正在研究比先前计划提前三四年在其旗舰项目投产的方案。【原文：SolGold Plc, an Ecuador-focused firm backed by some of the biggest names in mining, is working on options to start production at its flagship project three or four years ahead of previous plans.】

item.title: 美洲和西班牙的良好业绩推动 Enel 利润增长
item.description: Enel SpA 第一季度利润超出预期，主要得益于其在拉丁美洲和西班牙的良好业绩。【原文：Enel SpA’s first-quarter profit beat expectations thanks largely to its good performance in Latin America and Spain.】

item.title: 三张图看贸易战如何加剧加拿大的房贷压力
item.description: 加拿大银行警告说，一场严重而持久的全球贸易战可能会导致更多的抵押贷款借款人拖欠还款，甚至超过全球金融危机时的水平。【原文：The Bank of Canada warned that a severe and long-lasting global trade war may cause more mortgage borrowers to fall behind on their payments — even beyond levels reached in the global financial crisis.】

item.title: Meta从谷歌回国后任命人工智能实验室新负责人
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc.告诉员工，该公司已选择罗伯特-弗格斯（Robert Fergus）掌管其人工智能研究实验室，提升了这位曾在竞争对手Alphabet Inc.任职前帮助创办该实验室的员工的职位。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. told staff that it’s chosen Robert Fergus to helm its artificial intelligence research lab, elevating an employee who helped start the lab before a stint at competitor Alphabet Inc.】

item.title: 全球贸易紧张局势缓解，比特币突破 100,000 美元
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布与英国达成贸易协定后，贸易紧张局势有望缓解，比特币自 2 月份以来首次突破 100,000 美元门槛。【原文：Bitcoin crossed the $100,000 threshold for the first time since February, fueled by expectations of easing trade tensions after US President Donald Trump announced a trade agreement with the UK.】

item.title: 美联储调查显示三年通胀观点创 2022 年以来新高
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行的月度调查显示，4月份美国人对中期通胀的预期攀升至近三年来的新高，而他们对就业市场的看法则有所恶化。【原文：Americans’ expectations for inflation in the medium-term climbed to an almost three-year high in April while their views on the job market worsened, according to a monthly survey from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布与英国达成框架协议，降低贸易壁垒
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布了与英国的贸易框架，称其为一项 "突破"，将降低壁垒并扩大美国进口商品的市场准入。【原文：US President Donald Trump announced a trade framework with the UK, hailing it as a “breakthrough” that will bring down barriers and expand market access for American imports.】

item.title: 美国因伊朗石油问题制裁中国第三家 "茶壶 "炼油厂
item.description: 美国财政部制裁了中国的一家炼油厂以及港口码头运营商、船只、公司和个人，指责他们为伊朗原油贸易提供便利，并称这为德黑兰的军事活动提供了资金，违反了美国现有的制裁措施。【原文：The US Treasury Department sanctioned an oil refinery in China — along with port terminal operators, vessels, companies and individuals — it accuses of facilitating the Iranian crude trade, which it said funds Tehran’s military and violates existing US sanctions.】

item.title: 特朗普官员考虑快速处理与海湾财富基金的交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，特朗普官员已在内部讨论了可能给予阿拉伯联合酋长国、沙特阿拉伯和卡塔尔特殊的快速交易地位，此举可为数十亿美元的投资铺平道路。【原文：Trump officials have internally discussed potentially granting the United Arab Emirates, Saudi Arabia and Qatar a special fast-track status for deals, a move that could smooth the way for billions in investments, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 米尔肯公司与会者在公开场合表现出对经济的冷静，私下里却忧心忡忡
item.description: 在本周的米尔肯研究所全球会议上，与会者在比佛利希尔顿酒店的舞台上听到了许多乐观的谈话，亿万富翁和高管们经常对市场和全球经济状况持乐观态度。【原文：Attendees of this week’s Milken Institute Global Conference heard a lot of upbeat chatter from the stages of the Beverly Hilton hotel, where billionaires and executives frequently took a sanguine tone about the state of markets and the global economy.】

item.title: 私人信贷基金业绩暴露市场压力区
item.description: 从定制瓷砖制造商到殡葬服务提供商，根据商业发展公司的最新结果，一些由私人借贷机构融资的公司在第一季度开始出现压力迹象。市场观察人士认为，随着全球贸易战的影响对借款人造成压力，这一趋势可能会加速。【原文：From a custom tile maker to a funeral service provider, a number of companies financed by private lenders started showing signs of stress in the first quarter, according to recent results from business development companies. Market watchers say the trend is likely to accelerate as effects of the global trade war weigh on borrowers.】

item.title: 安本、Mesarete Capital Mull 加入黎巴嫩债券持有人小组
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，安本集团（Aberdeen Group PLC）和对冲基金Mesarete Capital LLP正在考虑加入一个海外债权人团体，为黎巴嫩主权债券持有人的下一步行动进行谈判。【原文：Aberdeen Group PLC and hedge fund Mesarete Capital LLP are considering joining a group of overseas creditors negotiating next steps for holders of Lebanon’s sovereign bonds, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 法国抨击欧盟散户投资者保护计划代价高昂
item.description: 法国呼吁欧盟撤回一项具有里程碑意义的提案，以加强对散户投资者的保护，称目前的草案将给资产管理公司带来沉重负担，并赶走客户。【原文：France is calling on the European Union to dial back a landmark proposal improving the protection for retail investors, saying the current draft would impose onerous burdens on asset managers and drive away clients.】

item.title: 欧洲央行官员听取关于普京的俄罗斯所构成军事威胁的简报
item.description: 据熟悉讨论情况的人士透露，欧洲中央银行理事会在上一次利率制定会议开始时深入分析了俄罗斯在东欧的潜在军事侵略所带来的风险。【原文：The European Central Bank Governing Council was given an in-depth analysis of the risks posed by potential Russian military aggression in eastern Europe at the start of its last rate-setting meeting, according to people familiar with the discussion.】

item.title: 加拿大央行称贸易战引发 "无序 "抛售风险
item.description: 加拿大央行警告说，持续的关税争端已经 "激怒了市场"，并增加了 "无序 "抛售的风险，这将考验该国的金融体系。【原文：The Bank of Canada is warning that the ongoing tariff dispute has “rattled markets” and increases the risk of “disorderly” selloffs that would test the country’s financial system.】

item.title: Whoop 推出具有血压和心电图功能的超薄健身手环
item.description:
评论：Whoop 5.0和MG — 医疗级的缩写— 旨在吸引更广泛的用户群，而不仅仅是运动员。【原文：

Review: The Whoop 5.0 and MG — short for medical grade — are meant to appeal to a broad user base beyond just athletes.

】

item.title: 特朗普吹捧与英国的贸易协定，美国股市上涨
item.description: 美国股市周四开盘攀升，投资者对美国和英国之间达成贸易协定的消息表示欢迎；一些交易商称，这一广受期待的进展可能成为更广泛的全球谈判的蓝图。【原文：US stocks climbed at the open Thursday as investors welcomed news of a trade agreement between the US and the UK — a widely anticipated development that some traders say could serve as a blueprint for broader global negotiations.】

item.title: 加拿大将在七国集团内首次建造小型模块化核反应堆
item.description: 加拿大省政府批准了建造一种新型、小型核电站的计划，为这一新兴产业注入了一剂强心针。【原文：Canada’s provincial government approved plans to build a new, smaller kind of nuclear power plant, providing a significant shot in the arm for the nascent industry.】

item.title: 真的，没人知道会发生什么
item.description:

item.title: Coinbase 以 29 亿美元收购加密货币期权交易所 Deribit
item.description: Coinbase Global Inc. 表示，它将以 29 亿美元的价格收购全球最大的比特币和以太币期权交易所 Deribit，这家美国最大的加密货币交易所将进军衍生品市场。【原文：Coinbase Global Inc. said it is acquiring Deribit, the world’s largest exchange for Bitcoin and Ether options, for $2.9 billion as the biggest US crypto exchange makes a push into the derivatives market.】

item.title: 美国和英国将发布贸易公告
item.description: 英国费利克斯托港的集装箱船。摄影师：Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg【原文：Container ships at the Port of Felixstowe in Felixstowe, UK. Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg】

item.title: 美国申请失业救济人数在春季休会期间短暂飙升后出现下降
item.description: 美国失业救济金申请人数在经历了春季休会和 4 月底复活节假期的短期飙升后，上周有所下降。【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits fell last week after a short-term spike coinciding with spring recess and the Easter holiday at the end of April.】

item.title: 产出下降，美国生产力自 2022 年以来首次下降
item.description: 随着经济产出的下降，美国第一季度的劳动生产率出现了近三年来的首次下降，从而结束了有助于缓和就业成本对通胀影响的连续增效。【原文：US labor productivity fell in the first quarter for the first time in nearly three years as economic output declined, snapping a streak of efficiency gains that have helped temper the inflationary impact from employment costs.】

item.title: 智利年度通胀放缓，政策制定者警惕物价上涨压力
item.description: 智利上个月的年度通胀率降幅超过预期，原因是决策者对近期的消费价格压力和更加动荡的全球经济前景保持警惕。【原文：Chile’s annual inflation eased more than expected last month as policymakers kept their guard up against both near-term consumer price pressures and a more turbulent global economic outlook.】
